title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: SDHI & Varex sign manufacturing agreement in India
items.summary:
- *SDHI* and *Varex Imaging Corporation* have partnered to produce **cargo and vehicle inspection systems** in India.
- Manufacturing will occur at SDHI's shipyard in Pipavav, supporting *Make in India* and enhancing *domestic security technology*.
- These systems will aid **port security** and meet rising demand from **Indian security agencies**, emphasizing *local production* and **global standards**.

items.title: SAIL supplies steel for INS Ajay & Nistar
items.summary:
- *Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL)* provided *special grade steel* for the Indian Navy's ships, *INS Ajay* and *INS Nistar*.
- The *INS Ajay*, launched in July 2025, is an *Anti-Submarine Warfare* vessel built by GRSE, with steel ensuring *structural integrity*.
- *INS Nistar*, a *diving support vessel* for submarine rescue, was also equipped with SAIL's steel, enhancing *India's naval capabilities*.

*Emphasizes* SAIL's strategic role in supporting *national defense* and building an *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.

items.title: Avaada Electro appoints Kaushal Shah as CFO
items.summary:
*Avaada Electro*, part of the Avaada Group, has appointed *Kaushal Shah* as its new *CFO* to oversee financial strategy, stakeholder engagement, and compliance.

- Shah brings over *30 years* of experience in finance, with expertise in capital markets, mergers, and financial planning.

- The company aims to improve *solar technology efficiency* and power output, aligning with global standards and sustainability goals.

items.title: Sona BLW reports 12% decline in Q1 net profit to ₹125 crore
Hindustan Zinc expands green logistics partnership
items.summary:
• Hindustan Zinc has partnered with GreenLine Mobility to deploy *electric* and *LNG trucks*, supporting *decarbonisation*.
• The initiative includes a ₹400 crore investment to introduce 100 *electric trucks* with a *battery swapping* system, and 100 *LNG trucks*.
• The project aims to reduce *236 metric tonnes of CO₂ emissions* monthly and achieve *net zero emissions* by 2050, marking a significant step in *green logistics*.

items.title: Calderys expands operations in India with new production lines at Odisha facility
Why global players are choosing India as a manufacturing hub
Staffing trends: Tech recruitment stagnant; AI and cloud skills drive demand outside IT
items.summary:
- *India's IT services sector* has seen *flat hiring* over the past 6-7 quarters, with demand shifting to *GCCs* and *non-IT sectors*.  
- *Demand for skills* in *artificial intelligence, cloud computing,* and *cybersecurity* is driving high-margin staffing growth, especially in *professional staffing*.  
- *Manufacturing, BFSI,* and *telecom* sectors are the primary growth drivers, despite challenges in *retail* and *auto*, with *over 1,200 open mandates* indicating continued hiring momentum.

items.title: Boeing appoints Alay Parikh for India defence sales
items.summary:
- *Alay Parikh* has been appointed as the head of *Boeing's defense and services sales* in India.
- He brings nearly *20 years of experience* with Boeing, including roles in strategy, supply chain, and programme management.
- His appointment aims to deepen Boeing’s engagement with the *Indian defence ecosystem*, especially in *domestic defence procurement* and local industry participation.

items.title: Adani Group Denies Battery Partnership with BYD
items.summary:
- *Adani Group* refutes reports of discussions with Chinese company *BYD* for *battery manufacturing* or *clean energy* collaborations.
- The group emphasizes it is not exploring any partnerships with BYD or *Beijing WeLion New Energy*.
- Despite denying ties, *Adani* is actively expanding its **solar**, **wind**, and **green hydrogen** capacities as part of its *clean energy* strategy, but not through BYD.

items.title: Over 3,000 Boeing fighter jet workers go on strike after rejecting contract offer
items.summary:
- Over 3,200 Boeing union workers at the St. Louis and Illinois facilities **went on strike** after rejecting a *second contract offer*.
- The proposed four-year contract would have increased wages by about 40%, with bonuses, more vacation, and sick leave, but was declined.
- Boeing plans to implement a *contingency plan* using non-labor workers, and management remains confident in handling the strike's impact, noting past resilience.

**Keywords:** Boeing strike, fighter jets, contract negotiations, aerospace labor, US defense manufacturing

items.title: US trade officials confirm tariff rates are final
items.summary:
*US tariff rates are largely *final* with little room for negotiation, according to trade officials.*
- President Trump has set steep tariffs ranging from 10% to 50% on several countries, including Brazil.
- Trade officials indicate that these *rates are more or less locked in* as the August deadline approaches, with some negotiations ongoing but limited changes expected.*

items.title: L&T Wins Big Solar & Storage Project in Bihar
items.summary: *Larsen & Toubro* secured an order to develop a **116 MW** solar plant in Bihar, integrated with a **241 MWh Battery Energy Storage System (BESS)**. *The project* supports India’s push for renewable energy and long-term energy resilience. The BESS, with a 4-hour storage capacity, will enable *energy time-shifting* and improve grid stability, making it the largest such project awarded by a state utility in India.*

items.title: Vikram Solar secures 250 MW Maharashtra order
items.summary:
*Vikram Solar* has received an order for **250 MW** of high-efficiency N-Type solar PV modules from *Bondada Group* for a project in Maharashtra.
- The modules, listed in India’s ALMM, will support India's renewable capacity growth with delivery expected in FY 2025–26.
- This collaboration advances Maharashtra’s clean energy goals and demonstrates *Vikram Solar*'s ongoing commitment to scalable and reliable solar solutions.

**Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 5, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** ["Vikram Solar", "Bondada Group", "renewable energy", "solar modules", "India"]

items.title: JSW Steel, JFE to invest $669M in electrical steel capacity
items.summary:
*JSW Steel* and *JFE Steel* will jointly invest about ₹5,845 crore to expand *electrical steel* production in India. 
- The expansion aims to increase capacity at Nashik and Vijayanagar plants, with phase-wise commissioning starting from FY2028. 
- *Cold rolled grain-oriented electrical steel* is highly energy-efficient, helping reduce *carbon emissions* and meet domestic demand.

items.title: Maharashtra’s Vidarbha as a logistics hub
items.summary:
*Vedarbha region in Maharashtra is set to become a major **logistics hub** via new infrastructure projects.*
- The Union Minister announced road, port, and mining projects to connect Vidarbha to eastern ports and southern markets, aiming to **reduce logistics costs**.
- Key developments include a new expressway to Vijayawada, port connections, the Raipur-Visakhapatnam corridor, and hydrogen vehicle pilot projects, strengthening the region's industrial network.

items.title: Sirca Paints Q1 Profit Rises 39% to ₹14 Cr
items.summary:
- **Sirca Paints** reported a **39.2% increase** in *consolidated net profit* to ₹14.20 crore for Q1 FY26, driven by growth in *margin* and *sales*.
- Revenue surged by **45.26%** to ₹114.24 crore, with total expenses rising 44%, and *EBITDA margin* improving to 19.74%.
- The company expanded by relocating its manufacturing units and acquiring Wembley paints, maintaining a **positive outlook** for future *growth* and *value creation*.

items.title: VinFast targets India for EV component sourcing
items.summary:
- *VinFast*, a Vietnamese EV manufacturer, is **expanding its sourcing** practices to India, focusing on local components.
- The company’s new plant in Tamil Nadu aims to produce up to **150,000 units annually** and serve both domestic and overseas markets.
- This move reflects a broader trend of global manufacturers seeking to diversify supply chains away from China, with India emerging as a key hub for *manufacturing and exports*.

items.title: India's Semiconductor Mission: From Aspirant to Powerhouse
items.summary:
- **India launched the Semiconductor Mission (ISM)** in December 2021 with a ₹76,000 crore budget to develop its semiconductor ecosystem.
- The initiative aims to boost *manufacturing*, *design*, and *R&D*, supported by government incentives and partnerships with global institutions.
- With numerous projects, a growing design startup sector, and skill development programs, India is positioning itself as a *global semiconductor hub* to reduce reliance on concentrated supply chains and enhance economic and strategic security.

items.title: Tuticorin to get ₹5,600cr defence & space investments
items.summary:
*Tuticorin will host three major investments worth over ₹5,600 crore in defence and space tech.*
- Sakthi Group will build a ₹5,000 crore ammunition and propellants facility, employing around 2,000 people.
- Two startups, Ethereal Exploration Guild and Agnikul Cosmos, will establish manufacturing/testing facilities for rocket engines and launch vehicles, creating approximately 1,100 jobs.
- These projects position Tuticorin as Tamil Nadu's emerging *space tech cluster*, aligning with the state's goal to attract ₹10,000 crore in investments and create 10,000 jobs in the sector.*

items.title: GHV Infra bags ₹2,645-cr UAE smart hub deal
items.summary:
- *GHV Infra Projects* secured a ₹2,645 crore EPC contract in the UAE for a *smart manufacturing hub* in Ras Al Khaimah.
- The project, to be completed in 24 months, will develop industrial and commercial buildings and boost GHV's order book to over ₹7,000 crore.
- The company is also planning bonus shares and a stock split, indicating strategic growth and shareholder benefits.

items.title: Taiwan faces economic risks from US semiconductor tariffs
items.summary:
*Taiwan's economy is at risk due to potential US tariffs on semiconductors.*
- The semiconductor industry is crucial for Taiwan, accounting for over **70%** of exports to the US.
- A targeted tariff could significantly impact Taiwan's trade surplus and ongoing investments, like TSMC's in Arizona, and influence US-Asia trade dynamics.

items.title: Renault Acquires Full Control of Nissan's Tamil Nadu Plant
items.summary:
*Renault has bought Nissan's 51% stake in their joint Chennai plant, becoming the sole owner.*
- The plant, with a production capacity of over 400,000 vehicles, has produced over 2.8 million vehicles since 2010, including exports to 100+ countries.
- Renault aims to boost sales, improve capacity utilization, and introduce new models, including a multi-energy modular platform, in India.

**Keywords:** Renault, Nissan, Tamil Nadu, automobile manufacturing, India market, plant ownership, vehicle exports

items.title: PM Modi announces BrahMos in Lucknow
items.summary: *Prime Minister Modi lauded India's indigenous weapons, especially highlighting their use during Operation Sindoor.* *He announced that BrahMos missiles will soon be manufactured in Lucknow, strengthening India's defense capabilities.* *Major defense firms are setting up manufacturing plants in the UP defense corridor, promoting 'Made in India' weapons as a force multiplier.*

items.title: New EU rule may stir up trouble for Araku coffee exports
FMCG companies pursue sugar-free products
items.summary:
*FMCG giants like Nestle, Britannia, and Tata are reducing sugar, salt, and fats in their products.*
- Many companies are increasing wholegrains, micronutrients, and adopting healthier formulations in response to consumer wellness goals.
- The trend reflects a broader movement towards *health-conscious food choices* across India, balancing nourishment with taste preferences.

items.title: Trump tariffs impact on renewable energy industry
items.summary:
- *US tariffs* on Indian clean energy imports cause *short-term* impact on solar exports, especially affecting profitability.
- The tariffs may accelerate *India's domestic manufacturing* growth and reduce *import dependency* in the long run.
- Experts warn that *global supply chain stability* could be threatened, complicating the energy transition process.
keywords: Trump tariffs impact on renewable energy

items.title: India receives final 16 Airbus C-295 aircraft in Spain
items.summary:
- The Indian Embassy in Spain received the last of 16 *Airbus C-295 military transport aircraft* in Seville, ahead of schedule.
- This delivery marks a significant step in India's efforts to boost *self-reliance in defense* and indigenous aircraft manufacturing.
- The programme includes 56 aircraft, with initial units imported and the remaining produced domestically at the new *TATA Aircraft Complex* in Gujarat, under the *Make in India* initiative, enhancing *India's defense capabilities*.

items.title: US tariff hike impacts Indian auto parts & tyres
items.summary:
*The US's 25% tariff on Indian imports significantly threatens India’s *auto components* and *tyre exports*, which make up 27% and 17% of India's exports respectively.* 
- Indian exporters are advised to explore *new markets* and focus on *cost optimization* to counteract the impact.
- The move could slow growth in the export-driven automotive sector unless *trade negotiations* or *alternative strategies* are implemented quickly.

items.title: UP aims to become a global leather hub with new policies
items.summary:
*Uttar Pradesh plans to strengthen its leather and footwear sectors with a focused policy, leveraging regional strengths like Agra, Kanpur, and Unnao.*
- The *draft policy* emphasizes *cluster-based development*, potential for *22 lakh new jobs*, and incentives for related units, aiming for comprehensive *design-to-delivery* ecosystem.
- The policy also includes *streamlined land utilization, digital processes, and incentives* to attract investment and boost the state's position as a *global manufacturing hub.*

items.title: Indian Army's ₹223 crore Tank Transporter Deal
items.summary:
*The Indian Army signed a ₹223.95 crore deal with Axiscades Aerospace for 212 next-gen Tank Transporter Trailers.*
- *These trailers, equipped with hydraulic and pneumatic ramps, will enhance mobility over tough terrains.*
- *The deal supports the 'Aatmnirbhar Bharat' initiative, boosting indigenous defence manufacturing and employment.*

items.title: India's semiconductor mission boosts digital sovereignty
items.summary:
*India's semiconductor initiative promotes *digital sovereignty* and aims for self-reliance across tech sectors.*
- The government seeks to develop indigenous capabilities in *chip design, fabrication, and packaging* to reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.*
- The mission includes plans to manufacture high-end chips, including *2-3 nanometre* technologies, and expand rare earth metal sourcing for electronics.*

items.title: Centre should take inputs from 2 large manufacturing states: T R B Rajaa
items.summary:
- *T R B Rajaa*, Tamil Nadu Industries Minister, urges the Centre to consult **large manufacturing states** like Tamil Nadu and Maharashtra.
- He emphasizes the importance of *responsibility over politics* in decision-making, especially concerning tariffs and industrial growth.
- The minister hopes the government will consider inputs from these states to balance concerns of **farmers**, the **primary sector**, and **industrial development**.

items.title: India Resists US Tariff Demands, Keeps Farm and GM Food Tariffs
items.summary:
*India has strengthened its stance against offering duty concessions on agricultural, dairy, and GM foods in trade negotiations with the US.*
- The US has announced an additional 25% import duty on Indian goods starting August 7, amid stalled trade talks.
- India emphasizes protecting small farmers and food security by refusing to relax tariffs on sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy, and maintaining restrictions on GM foods.

**Key points:**
- India seeks to preserve tariffs to shield its rural economy and small farmers.
- The US aims for reduced duties on various industrial and agricultural products, including GM foods.
- The trade dispute highlights ongoing tensions in the bilateral negotiations for a comprehensive trade agreement.

items.title: iPhones for US now mostly assembled in India
items.summary:
- *Apple CEO Tim Cook* confirmed that most iPhones sold in the US are now assembled in *India*, marking a significant shift in the *global supply chain*. 
- China’s role has diminished, mainly producing for non-US markets, while *India* and *Vietnam* lead manufacturing for other Apple products. 
- Despite supply chain changes, *India's* market is growing rapidly, with Apple expanding its *retail presence* and sales across emerging markets like *India, Brazil*, and the *Middle East*.

items.title: Tamil Nadu partners with IIT Madras for semiconductor centre
items.summary:
*Tamil Nadu has partnered with IIT Madras to establish the *Centre for Advanced Semiconductor Technologies* under its Semiconductor Mission 2030.*
- The centre, located in Chennai, will feature India's first in situ semiconductor fab processing facility and focus on research, innovation, and startup incubation.
- The initiative aims to create a skilled *semiconductor workforce*, support MSMEs, and enhance capabilities in sectors like electric vehicles and space technology, with a seed grant of Rs 100 crore.*

items.title: Aviation fuel pricier, LPG to cost less
items.summary:
*Aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices increased by 3%, raising airline operating costs.*
*Meanwhile, commercial LPG cylinder rates decreased by ₹33.50, marking the fifth consecutive reduction.*
*Prices vary across cities due to local taxes, and domestic LPG rates remain unchanged.*

items.title: Nayara Energy reassesses export plans amid sanctions
items.summary:
- *Nayara Energy* offers petrol and diesel exports to Indian state-run refiners due to *sanctions* impacting its international operations.
- The company has *reduced refinery run rates* and faces challenges from EU sanctions linked to its stake in *Rosneft*, Russia's energy giant.
- Despite these hurdles, Nayara commits to a *long-term investment plan* of over *₹70,000 crore* in petrochemicals, ethanol, and infrastructure, emphasizing *India's energy security* and community support.

items.title: India's ITC exceeds profit expectations on sales growth
items.summary:
- **ITC** reported a *better-than-expected* Q1 profit, driven by increased **sales in cigarettes and packaged foods**, especially in *rural areas*.  
- The company benefited from **rural demand resilience** and an early signs of recovery in urban consumer goods demand, with a 20% revenue increase year-on-year.  
- **Price hikes** and a **39% growth** in *agri business* revenues contributed to the company's strong financial performance, amid easing inflation and supportive policies.

items.title: McDonald's doubles AI investments by 2027
items.summary:
- *McDonald's* plans to **double AI investments** by 2027, focusing on expanding AI tools across global locations.
- The company is establishing a major **AI hub in India**, particularly in Hyderabad, to support data governance and platform architecture.
- AI is already used to verify orders and forecast sales, with efforts to enhance personalization and reduce costs without increasing headcount.

**Scores**: {"scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8},
**keywords**: ["McDonald's AI investment", "artificial intelligence in fast food", "India operations", "Hyderabad", "global capability center"]}

items.title: Intel Manufacturing Faces Setbacks Amid Restructuring
items.summary:
- Intel's manufacturing *operations* are experiencing significant *shifts*, with three senior executives announcing their *retirement*. 
- CEO *Lip-Bu Tan* has revealed a major *restructuring plan*, including workforce reductions and scaling back manufacturing investments, especially in the *14A* and *18A* chip processes. 
- These changes reflect *ongoing challenges* and strategic shifts aimed at revitalizing the company’s operations and focusing on key *technology development* initiatives.

items.title: India to produce over 24 billion chips annually
items.summary:
- *India's government* has approved semiconductor projects expected to produce over *24 billion chips annually*. 
- The projects include a *wafer fabrication plant* by Tata Electronics and five packaging units, with more proposals in progress. 
- *India* aims to be a *long-term global player* in the *semiconductor supply chain*, supported by policies and international collaborations.

items.title: Malaysian exports exempt from US tariffs
items.summary:
- The US imposed a 19% tariff on Malaysian imports, with *pharmaceuticals* and *semiconductors* exempted.
- Malaysia secured exemptions through ongoing *trade negotiations*, with potential for more exclusions.
- The agreement maintains Malaysia's *sovereign rights*, rejecting US requests on certain *regulatory* and *investment* issues.

items.title: Sundram Fasteners' Record Q1 FY26 Revenue & Profit
items.summary:
- *Sundram Fasteners* posted its **highest-ever quarterly revenue** of ₹1,533.39 crore and net profit of ₹147.94 crore in Q1 FY26.
- Revenue growth was driven by **robust domestic demand**, improved EBITDA margin, and operational efficiencies, despite export challenges.
- The company continues to focus on **capacity expansion, innovation**, and monitoring global trade impacts for sustained growth.

items.title: Ergo invests €130M in GenAI, relies on India for global growth
items.summary:
*German insurer Ergo will invest over €130 million over five years to develop *GenAI* infrastructure, with *India* playing a key role.*
- The investment focuses on building core AI capabilities to support Ergo’s goal of becoming a leading *digital insurer* by 2025.*
- Ergo leverages India’s *tech talent* and *infrastructure*, with its Mumbai hub acting as a global tech center and deploying advanced *AI algorithms* and *robotics* across operations.*

items.title: Jubilant Ingrevia's Strategic Shift Boosts EBITDA
items.summary:
- *Jubilant Ingrevia* shifted focus from *commodities* to *specialty chemicals*, leading to a **54%** net profit rise and a **29%** EBITDA increase despite flat revenues.
- The **‘Pinnacle’ strategy** involved a ₹2,000 crore investment, resulting in higher margins, especially in specialty chemicals (27% EBITDA margin), aiming for overall margins near 20%.
- The company is leveraging *digital transformation*, *Generative AI*, and emerging *semiconductor CDMO opportunities*, positioning itself as an *innovation-led chemical provider* with a long-term outlook.

items.title: Samsung partners Startup India to power local innovators
India's next Y2K moment in hardware: Why smart factories need a skill revolution
L&T secures ₹2,500–5,000 crore order from Vedanta’s Hindustan Zinc
Three Intel senior executives to retire amid manufacturing shake up
